channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish dumped by a tree on residential street, 9th October
item.description:
Fly tipping of broken bed frames, headboards, mattress and baby cot on the street. Blocking the pathway. It’s been over two weeks and the longer it’s there the more rubbish is added to the pile

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arkindale Road, Southend, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned bikes?, 9th October
item.description:
I have put this under litter section as there does not seem to be a category for bikes. These two bikes have been here for weeks, one has a buckled wheel.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crab Hill, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree blown over, 9th October
item.description:
Big tree snapped in half, hanging dangerously

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Langbrook Road, Kidbrooke, London

item.title: Smashed glass all over pavement as usual, 9th October
item.description:
Bus stop opposite Falconwood train station entrance. Pavement is always covered in glass

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Way, Avery Hill, London

item.title: Steel rod left on the pavement caused injury, 9th October
item.description:
On the 09.10.25 about 15.35 my child was travelling home from Woodberry down primary school, near by the Sainsbury's on Woodberry Grove road junction of Seven Sisters Road works are carried out over few weeks now. my child was walking he tripped over

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woodberry Grove, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Keep clear road markings, 9th October
item.description:
Please can you reinstate the KEEP CLEAR road marking at the junction of parkside avenue and the Perry Street roundabout. The area has been tarmacked recently with the road markings re painted except the keep clear. It's almost impossible to get out of parkside avenue on the best if days, at least the keep clear sign helped let cars travel over the junction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parkside Avenue, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bus shelter outside the Prince Albert pub not working for the umpteenth time, 9th October
item.description:
Bus shelter outside the Prince Albert pub not working for the umpteenth time. Tourists and others in a constant sense of confusion at this site
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Pembridge Road, Notting Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 32 Fitzroy Roada, 9th October
item.description:
Today my daughter was playing in the street and in front of house number 32, right on the black iron fence at the entrance, there is a long wire with electricity running through it. I was lucky that my daughter didn't get electrocuted. I don't know how they have the right to have six electric wires on a public fence.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Fitzroy Road, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 9th October
item.description:
Vehicle abandoned this small dead end road is used by delivery vans parking their vans blocking the street there is no yellow lines parking restrictions this road is used a a free car park please address this yellow lines are needed
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Barn Way, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Builders blocked the pathway all week, 9th October
item.description:
Daisy Lane Builders have blocked the pathway all week with their work. I am disabled and had to walk in the road when walking my dog. Surely builders shouldn’t be able to use the pavement as their personal workspace.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Birkbeck Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Telecom/power box has the door beside it. Dangerous?, 9th October
item.description:
This has been broken for some time and looks dangerous. The door is beside it, but not attached. Thank you for your attention.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Warwick Square, Pimlico, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Several stickers and graffiti on street nameplate

item.title: Daily fly tipping, 9th October
item.description:
Daily fly tipping. bags of rubbish, white good, toys, broken furniture. Possible overcrowding in flats and no access to bins.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Northwold Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road markings, 9th October
item.description:
This is the third time in this year I have brought to your attention that the road and parking space markings along Eastbury Road need to be repainted. On the two previous occasions the topic was closed, having been given to the Council's contractor. Could some management be applied to this simple issue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eastbury Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped rubbish, 9th October
item.description:
There’s been rubbish dumped between house numbers 22 and 23 Everington Road, N10 1HT I don’t know the exact date this was dumped as I have been in hospital, so sometime in the last two weeks. People are now adding to it. I got my friends son to tidy it up as it was all over the place, this alley is also a fire escape for the residents,

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Everington Road, Muswell Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Recurring fly tipping/littering issue, 9th October
item.description:
There is a recurring issue with fly tipping and littering on Darnley Road towards Mare Street by commercial premises - appears to be Rachel Allen Interiors (see pictures).

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Darnley Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bruising materials in road, 9th October
item.description:
Been like this for over a moth
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 107,109, Woodside Lane, Blendon, London

item.title: Graffiti and atickers on lamp posts, 9th October
item.description:
General eyesore of stickers and graffiti in the area of the bridge. The area of the bridge needs repainting and pressure washing of stickers and sign posts

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Way Relief Road, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tarmac defects, 9th October
item.description:
Hello, Please can the pavement outside our house be repaired? Big sections of tarmac have crumbled away and each time we use the car, more of it is damaged. I've tripped over it a few times or skidded on loose material and we worry the chips could fly up and scratch the car. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Way, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet
